body.p: offers an add-on that provides experimental support for helping translators. Once the add-on is installed, you can use Google Translate to create a preliminary translation for your XML content, translation which can later be manually improved. The add-on is useful also to quickly translate XML content and show potential customers how a DITA project will look like in their native language.
To install the add-on, follow these instructions:

ol.li: Go to Help > Install new add-ons... to open an add-on selection dialog box.
Enter or paste in the Show add-ons from field.
Select the Translator Helper add-on and click Next.
Select the I accept all terms of the end user license agreement option and click Finish.

You can translate the edited content using Google Translate to various languages:
Select the content to translate in the Author visual editing mode. You can select multiple paragraphs and even select all the document's content. Google Translate is limited to translating 5000 characters so you might need to translate your XML document in incremental stages.
Right click. Select Google Translate To and choose the target language.
Copy the translated content from the web page which will open in your default configured web browser. You can use the Copy translation button in the Google Translate web page to make sure you have copied the entire translation.
Click Replace in the Translate using Google Translate dialog that showed up in . The selected content should now be replaced with the translated content, obeying the original XML markup.
In addition you can choose in the Translate using Google Translate dialog to show the original document content in the Translator Helper side view. This will allow you to double check and improve on the translated text.

You can have your original content side by side with the content that you are editing, so you can translate correctly and easy by right clicking in the Author visual editing mode and invoking the Original Content Side By Side action. The side view will automatically scroll to the original content while you are translating the current XML document.
